org.actus.events

Class ContractEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.actus.events.ContractEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<ContractEvent>

    public final class ContractEvent
extends Object
implements Comparable<ContractEvent>
    Component that provides a data structure for a single event generated during the lifetime of a ContractType

    Contract events represent the atomic analytical elements comprising all events that possibly occur during the lifetime of a ContractType. That is, contract events mark specific times at which either a state transition, a payoff, or both is generated from a ContractType.

    Contract events are a generic representation of a specific StateTransitionFunction and PayOffFunction with an event time according to which all events in a contract are ordered (in an EventSeries) and processed sequentially. Thereby, processing an event in fact means that its StateTransitionFunction and PayOffFunction are evaluated.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(ContractEvent o)
        Imposes the natural ordering of events in an instrument's payoff amongst each other

        The natural ordering of contract events in an instrument's payoff is defined by a combination of the event's time (cf. time) and type (cf. type). In fact, the sum of event-time measured as epoch-seconds and an event-type specific time-offset according to EventSequence give a unique, event-specific index providing the order of events. Hence, their natural ordering imposes a time-consistent sequence of events (or a time-series).

        The imposed natural ordering is consistent with equals.

        Note that consistency of the natural ordering of events with equal is only guaranteed within the payoff (i.e. set of events) of a single instrument. If the events of multiple instruments are combined in a collection, o1.compareTo(o2)==0 of two events o1 from the payoff of an instrument and o2 from the payoff of another instrument does not imply that the two events are the same, i.e. equal.

        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<ContractEvent>
        Parameters:
        o - an event to which to compare this event
        Returns:
        -1 if this event is earlier than o, 0 if this event is equal than o, 1 if this event is after o
        See Also:
        EventSequence}

      • eval

        public void eval(StateSpace states,
                 ContractModelProvider model,
                 RiskFactorModelProvider riskFactorModel,
                 DayCountCalculator dayCounter,
                 BusinessDayAdjuster timeAdjuster)
        Evaluation of the event

        Upon evaluation of an event, it's PayOffFunction and StateTransitionFunction get evaluated in order to compute cash flow and update state variables.

        Parameters:
        states - the current state of contract states
        model - the model containing parsed contract attributes
        riskFactorModel - an external market model
        dayCounter - the day counter to be used for calculating day count fractions
        timeAdjuster - the business day convention to be used for adjusting times in day count fraction calculations

      • toArray

        public String[] toArray()
        Returns an array of Strings representing all analytical elements

        Note that the length of the returned array may change going forward as new states may be added with the addition of new ContractTypes. Thus, it is recommended to use the getter-methods for desired states (e.g. time, type, etc.) individually and parse to a String manually.

        Returns:
        an array of Strings with analytical elements

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a String-representation of all analytical elements

        Note that the number of analytical elements may change going forward as e.g. new states may be added with the addition of new ContractTypes. Thus, it is recommended to use the getter-methods for desired states (e.g. time, type, etc.) individually and parse to a String manually.

        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a single String containing all analytical elements
